page.title: 11Heather Cricket Club
page.content: Heather Sparkenhoe Cricket Club has existed for all of this century, originally playing where Sparkenhoe Estate now stands, and since 1947 on the 'Miners' Welfare' recreation ground, now owned by the Parish Council. The old pavilion has been demolished and replaced by one donated by the Coal Board in 1982. The club has a playing strength of over 30, with an age range of 15 - 50, and it contains several well-known village names such as Bradford, Cooper and Grewcock. The two Saturday teams now play in the Leicestershire Senior League, with clubs mainly from the Western side of the County. The Club enters two mid-week competitions, the Bardon Cup and the Heather Charity Cup (40 and over) which H.S.C.C. organise for the mentally handicapped.
